network

Class Message

  • java.lang.Object
    • network.Message

  • public class Message
extends java.lang.Object
    Acts as a generic message that can be sent through a network.

    Each message has a source, destination, and timestamp. This class should be extended to define a payload or other statistical information.

    Author:
    Bitidork

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Message(Node<Message> source, Node<Message> destination, int timestamp)
      Creates a packet heading from source to destination created at time slot time.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Message

        public Message(Node<Message> source,
       Node<Message> destination,
       int timestamp)
        Creates a packet heading from source to destination created at time slot time.
        Parameters:
        source - The Node that generated the cell.
        destination - The Node that the packet is for.
        timestamp - The time at which the packet was cell.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if source or destination are null
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if timestamp is negative
